snippet: Cole Aldrich scored a career-high 19 points as the Knicks beat the Magic in a game that may be most notable for the lowest-scoring quarter in N.B.A. history.
abstract: New York Knicks defeat Orlando Magic, 80-79; teams combined to score record low of 15 points in second quarter.
lead_paragraph: Cole Aldrich scored a career-high 19 points as the Knicks beat the Magic in a game that may be most notable for the lowest-scoring quarter in N.B.A. history.

headline.main: Another Sad Record for the Knicks
headline.print_headline: Another Sad Record for the Knicks
